p: The coronavirus SARS-CoV-2, responsible for the pandemic which started in Wuhan, China, during the latter part of 2019, has spread to 213 countries, areas and territories according to the WHO [ 1, 2] by April 16th 2020 and continues to spread, infecting approximately 84,500 and causing the death of approximately 8000 people daily. Although young people usually develop mild symptoms, it can cause severe lower respiratory disease affecting mostly the elderly and individuals with other co-morbidities such as cardiovascular problems, pre-existing respiratory disease, diabetes, hypertension or cancer [ 1].
